abstract.p: Joseph P Petta letter comments on August 24 Critic's Notebook column on CBS reality program, Survivor

Re ''Machiavelli, on a Desert Isle, Meets TV's Reality. Unreal'' (Critic's Notebook, front page, Aug. 24):

''Survivor,'' so-called reality television, makes one wonder if there can truly be an observed reality, or if reality television can ever be real. How much of the survivors' behavior was influenced by the presence of the camera?

''Survivor'' begs the application of Werner Heisenberg's uncertainty principle: the introduction of a means of observation (in this case, the camera) might alter the behavior of the observed. We can never be absolutely certain that something, or someone, will behave the same as when not being observed.
Watch children playing and see how quickly their behavior changes once they realize that someone is paying attention.
JOSEPH P. PETTA New York, Aug. 24, 2000
